Description: Irregularly shaped cakes of bread both round and triangular; some incomplete with extensive evidence of insect damage; removed from basket EA5391. Many holes made by beetles still contain the insects' bodies.
Curator's comments: Found in OC.167 Found with OC.169 Literature: - C.R. Cartwright and J.H. Taylor, Ancient Egyptian funerary food: New insights, British Museum Technical Research Bulletin 9 (2015), 97-105. - C.R. Cartwright, Aperture feature with scanning electron microscope images of “Breadbugs”, New Scientist 3087 (2016), 24-25.
SEM images in J.H. Taylor & D. Antoine, Ancient Lives New Discoveries, London 2014, p. 43.
Bibliographic references: Cartwright and Taylor 2015 / Ancient Egyptian funerary food: new insights (p.98, table.1, p.102, p.103, fig.9-10, p.105)
Exhibition history: 2014-15 22 May to 19 April, London, British Museum, 'Ancient Lives, New Discoveries' 2016-2017 10 Oct-30 Apr, Sydney, Powerhouse Museum, Ancient Lives 2017 16 Jun-18 Oct, Hong Kong Science Museum, Ancient Lives 2017-2018 14 Nov-20 Feb, Taiwan, National Palace Museum, Ancient Lives 2018 16 Mar-22 Jul, Brisbane, Queensland Museum of Art, Ancient Lives 2019-2020 14 Sept- 28 Jun, Montreal, Museum of Fine Arts, Ancient Lives EXTENDED DUE TO COVID19 2020-2021, 19 Sept - 21 Mar, Toronto, Royal Ontario Museum, Ancient Lives 2021-2022 9 Oct - 10 Jan, Tokyo, Museum of Science and Nature, Mummies of Ancient Egypt: rediscovering six lives (Egyptian Mummies 2) 2022 5 Feb- 8 May, Kobe City Museum, Mummies of Ancient Egypt: rediscovering six lives (Egyptian Mummies 2) 2022 14 Jul - 26 Oct, Madrid, CaixaForum, Mummies of Ancient Egypt: rediscovering six lives (Egyptian Mummies 2) 2022-2023 1 Dec – 19 Mar, Barcelona, CaixaForum, Mummies of Ancient Egypt: rediscovering six lives (Egyptian Mummies 2) 2023 25 Apr - 2 Sep, Seville, CaixaForum, Mummies of Ancient Egypt: rediscovering six lives (Egyptian Mummies 2) 2023-2024 4 Oct – 28 Jan, Valencia, CaixaForum, Mummies of Ancient Egypt: rediscovering six lives (Egyptian Mummies 2)
